Articles.Content:
So I have an intercept for Duna and it will be my first landing there! I have landed several times on Ike but never Duna I have crashed one probe though. I just got into doing proper transfers so this was mind blowingly efficient to me and that's why my transfer stage could probably get to Eeloo. I have one pic so far of the ship leaving Kerbin.

Its dark but it looks very cool. I can't wait to get to Duna.

The lander and transfer stage

The whole monster of the ship.

Doing the deorbit burn.

Sunset after landing.

First step.

Edited May 12, 2013 by dharak1
Congratcioulations(if I spelled correctly)! My problem isn't that I can't transfert, I just can't build a good vessle for landing
Great job!I am still working on my interplanetary rocket.

The best lander design of mine is a 180 liter and the small and short LV rocket with ASAS and three small lander legs with ladders. Soldierhair my interplanetary vehicles look crazy at launch but look more normal at transfer. at launch they have 9 mainsails.

The best lander design of mine is a 180 liter and the small and short LV rocket with ASAS and three small lander legs with ladders. Soldierhair my interplanetary vehicles look crazy at launch but look more normal at transfer. at launch they have 9 mainsails.

Thank you!, I had a few days ago docked a tanker to go to duna, during re-entry my shutes ripped-off my engines and stuff. I had no quicksaves
Would you like me to put a picture of the lander I am using or the whole ship?
I just made my first (successful) duna landing a minute ago!
Nice one... When I landed my first time on Duna I was bouncing around with happiness... This is from then...

I have a Duna capable ship that can hold 2 kerbals called summiter legacy and it landed on Ike with very little fuel and no aerobrake. I hope to send another to Duna. My first interplanetary capture was with Eve and I refused to use nuclear rockets for no reason. It was a miracle because I hadn't even landed on the mun. Also Neo what happened to Duna 1? Is it a station or... You know...

GREAT! So I had a set periapsis at 24000 meters and guess what. When I get there I'm at 20 million meters and no aerobrake for me! That's the most the prediction has ever been off! So I reloaded only to find my last quicksave was before I did my painstaking transfer burn.

Edit: Ok I have the encounter back near aerobrake levels so I'm happy

Edited May 12, 2013 by dharak1
Disable the time warp just before entering Duna's SoI, and your trajectory should remain unchanged. When you are timewarping entering the SoI it can jump around.

Aerobraking is fun for sure... I had one Duna capture where I was almost out of fuel but managed to get an aerobrake that ONLY just got me an orbit... Huge one but after about 10 cycles of aerobraking and then I manged to get in a circular orbit near to where my station was. Docked with about 12 units of fuel left lol.
Holy that's crazy! The main problem I have with docking on other planets after capture is that I often come in retro to the station.
Perfect! I did't timewarp like you said and it's at 20km like it should be! Ill get a pic of the aerobrake.
I have my first Duna mission prepped, theyre just waiting for the transfer window in orbit (Jeb is captain, so it's guaranteed to go right) It will be my first interplanetary mission.
Great to hear! Are you going to make a post about it? First interplanetary is pretty big.
I will if all goes to plan.
That's good. I'm about to start my Laythe mission.
